featureDescription.theme: Subject experts at the NEB are assigned to conditions that relate to specific sub-fields (e.g. finance, environment, safety). They also track compliance. These sub-fields are called Themes here.
featureDescription.phase: As a lifecycle regulator, the NEB ensures the safety of a project during all phases. Conditions can apply to one, several or all phases of the lifecycle. More information about the lifecycle can be found [TODO: NEEDS A LINK]here.
featureDescription.status: Conditions that are no longer active are closed. Some conditions may be active indefinitely or they refer to the continued operation of a pipeline for example. Others that apply to a specific phase will close, because they have been fulfilled (e.g. a specific filing during construction phase).
featureDescription.type: There are two main types of conditions: standard and non-standard.
featureDescription.filing: This feature explains whether a company is required to file a document in order to comply with a condition.
featureDescription.instrument: Regulatory instruments are official orders issued by NEB staff. An Instrument can include several conditions, and a project might have several instruments (i.e. orders)attached to it. All instruments have an instrument number. Searching for this number in the NEB’s [TODO: NEEDS A LINK]REGDOCS repository is one way to find the original regulatory instrument from which the conditions in this visualization are taken. The prefix of an instrument number is based on its meaning.

theme.ADMINISTRATIVE: types of conditions that ensure filings are made.
theme.DAMAGE_PREVENTION: types of conditions that ensure reduction and prevention of damage.
theme.EMERGENCY_MANAGEMENT: types of conditions that ensure appropriate measures are in place and updated, in case of an emergency.
theme.ENFORCEMENT: types of conditions that provide NEB officers with tools to ensure conditions are being fulfilled.
theme.ENVIRONMENTAL_PROTECTION: types of conditions that ensure that risk to the environment is minimized, monitored, and mitigated.
theme.FINANCIAL: types of conditions that ensure a company’s financial resposibilities are met.
theme.INTEGRITY_MANAGEMENT: types of conditions that ensure that projects are designed, built and upkept in order to prevent toxic spills and emissions escape.
theme.MANAGEMENT_SYSTEM: types of conditions that apply when a project is transeferred to another company. Ensures all Management systems are in place and the new company knows its requirements.
theme.SAFETY_MANAGEMENT: types of conditions that ensure that work on a project is safe for workers and affected individuals and communities.
theme.SECURITY: types of conditions that ensure that project facilities are monitored and secured.
theme.SOCIO_ECONOMIC: types of conditions that ensure that the concerns of affected communities and indigenous groups (e.g.traditional land use investigations, noise assesssments, etc).
theme.STANDARD_CONDITION: types of conditions which clearly state the compliance objective to be met by the company; promote due diligence by the Company, are enforceable by NEB compliance staff.
theme.SUNSET_CLAUSE: types of conditions that ensure that projects/phases begin in a specific period of time.

phase.ABANDONMENT: If a company wants to abandon a facility, it must submit an application, including an environmental and socio-economic assessment, to the NEB. NEB staff will assess the application and the NEB may hold a public hearing. If the abandonment is approved, the NEB may impose conditions and inspect the abandonment activities.
phase.DURING_CONSTRUCTION_PHASE: If an application for a facility is approved by the NEB, the NEB will regulate the construction and post-construction activities carried out by the company by monitoring compliance with the conditions of approval. These conditions may specify how and when a company will construct its facility. The NEB will monitor company compliance through inspections of construction activities and by reviewing the company’s post-construction monitoring reports.
phase.EXPIRY_DATE_OF_REGULATORY_INSTRUMENT: Some conditions apply when the regulatory instrument expires.
phase.INCLUDES_ALL_PHASES_OF_CONSTRUCTION: Some conditions apply at all phases of construction.
phase.NOT_CONSTRUCTION_RELATED: Some conditions apply outside of the construction context.
phase.POST_CONSTRUCTION_PHASE: If an application for a facility is approved by the NEB, the NEB will regulate the construction and post-construction activities carried out by the company by monitoring compliance with the conditions of approval. These conditions may specify how and when a company will construct its facility.
phase.PRIOR_TO_CONSTRUCTION_PHASE: Assigned to conditions that must be fulfilled before construction can begin. This includes conditions related to environmental and socio-economic assessments.

status.CLOSED: This status refers to a condition that has been fulfilled and no longer needs to be tracked.
status.IN_PROGRESS: This status refers to a condition that continues to be tracked and has not been fulfilled.

type.STANDARD: a standard condition will apply generally to project approvals and have been developed over time at the NEB to ensure consistency.
type.NON_STANDARD: a non-standard condition captures project-specific concerns that cannot be encompassed by standard conditions.

filing.REQUIRED: a company must file a document with the NEB in order to comply with a condition.
filing.NOT_REQUIRED: a company must not file a document with the NEB in order to comply with a condition

suggestedKeywordsPopout.keywordsDescription: Keywords capture the general idea of a condition, e.g. type of species regulated. Learn more about how we extracted keywords

data.title: Data Download
data.description: The data used to create this visualization is open data available for you to download. Click the icon to save the data file to your computer.

projectLegend.totalConditions: Total Number of Conditions for Project

header.title: Conditions on NEB-regulated energy projects
header.subtitle: This is an interactive tool for exploration of NEB conditions data through keywords and visual representation.
